id.description: Biosample identifier (external accession or internal ID).

individualId.description: Reference to the individual from which that sample was obtained.

notes.description: Any relevant info about the biosample that does not fit into any other field in the schema.

id.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

collectionDate.description: Date of biosample collection in ISO8601 format.

collectionMoment.description: Individual's or cell cullture age at the time of sample collection in the ISO8601 duration format `P[n]Y[n]M[n]DT[n]H[n]M[n]S`.

phenotypicFeatures.description: List of phenotypic abnormalities of the sample. RECOMMENDED.

items.title: PhenotypicFeature
items.description: Used to describe a phenotype that characterizes the subject or biosample.

id.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

excluded.description: (from Phenopackets v.2) Flag to indicate whether the disease was observed or not. Default is ‘false’, in other words the disease was observed. Therefore it is only required in cases to indicate that the disease was looked for, but found to be absent. More formally, this modifier indicates the logical negation of the OntologyClass used in the 'featureType' field. CAUTION It is imperative to check this field for correct interpretation of the disease!

modifiers.description: For instance one or more terms from HPO Clinical Modifier (HP:0012823). This subontology is designed to provide terms to characterize and specify the phenotypic abnormalities defined in the Phenotypic abnormality subontology, with respect to severity, laterality, age of onset, and other aspects. [ HPO:probinson ]

info.description: Placeholder to allow the Beacon to return any additional information that is necessary or could be of interest in relation to the query or the entry returned. It is recommended to encapsulate additional informations in this attribute instead of directly adding attributes at the same level than the others in order to avoid collision in the names of attributes in future versions of the specification.
